name: Hotel Lorenzo il Magnifico

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was very disappointed in this hotel. The room was very small and very got! We traveled to Florence in the Spring, the air conditioning had not yet been turned on and they still had the heat on. We asked them to turn the heat off. They did not even have a fan system to circulate the air, it was very hot and stuffy even with the window open. The bathroom was also very small, we had to sit sideways on the toilet because it was so close to the wall! It was not worth the money!
reviews.title: Hot and small!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although the hotel is in a quiet location about a 15-minute walk into the centre, it is excellent value for money. It also has its own secure parking, which was difficult to find in Florence.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, wonderful staff

reviews.text: The staff are very friendly and helpful, even providing us with complimentary maps and guidebooks to Florence. Our room was an excellent size, with a lovely bathroom and plenty of space although a little dark as we only had one window. Breakfast was lovely.
reviews.title: really good value for money

reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would definitely go back.
reviews.title: Very Nice
Mosquitos
reviews.text: Excellent hotel - despite of the fact that it faces a busy street.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an excellent small hotel situated about 20 minutes walk from central Florence.
reviews.title: Excellent small hotel, short walking distance to central Florence

likes.liked: — Staff, sympathetic conversion of a Florentine villa and breakfasts
likes.disliked: — Nothing - we knew it wasn't the 'Duomo on your doorstep' location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found it necessary to really study the maps to find directions to the hotel, this is because we drove from Pisa in the dark - probably a mistake. Florence's roads are tricky, lots of one-ways, including the hotel's street, plus the traffic volumes are bad. Anyway, we got there after a few detours. Google's Street View of Florence is excellent, it is especially useful to see what you're doing when a U-turn is needed on the Piazza della Liberta!
reviews.title: thank you

reviews.text: The hotel has car parking in the garden area. Unfortunately, it is a bit tight at times, but the hotel compensates superbly by offering valet parking. The whole deal is just Euros10 per night, which is very reasonable.
reviews.title: Beware of Room 401

reviews.text: We had a room in the "Garden" building, facing the garden, which I suppose was quieter than rooms in the front of the hotel - I didn't hear any ring road noise, but via Lorenzo Il Magnifico is itself a busy road.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay - Top Rate Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are first-rate - extremely helpful.
reviews.title: Good and not so good
Would recommend this hotel
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting florence and who is prepared to walk into the city and back again. The staff were very friendly and the breakfast staff were very keen to help. The hotel was in good condition, clean and our room was fine. There is a great little restaurant about a 10 minute walk towards the centre called Messere try it, and for those on a real budget on the opposite corner there you will find a really cheap place to eat offering reasonable quality food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PS. Try not to go in August if you can help it the Italians and the rest of the world holiday here then and if you go to the Ufizzi gallery reserve a ticket, we qued for 3.5 hours to get in. Enjoy....
reviews.title: Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My friend and I stayed at the Lorenzo il Magnifico at the end of May 2007. The hotel itself is just outside the main business district, but a very easy walk to all attractions and the train station. Our room air conditioner stopped working and we were immediately given a better room at no additional cost. The breakfast buffet was American-style with eggs, fresh fruit , assortment of breads and coffee. General Manager Marco and his staff were very friendly and accommodating. Would definitely go back again.
reviews.title: A real; gem

likes.liked: — Charming, European hotel, clean and classy
likes.disliked: — Not a single complaint from us.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a find. On short notice, we found a room here -- 4 stars at a reasonable rate since iit is not directly in the central area. But not so far. (It is not like Florence is NYC -- it is a small city/town). We walked it in the morining, cabbed home. 20 minute, flat walk (Was worried about how far this was really going to be, but it is in the city, just not in the historic area. ), 8-10 Euro cab. Great clean room, large, sploless bathroom (in the newer garden house annex), very comfortable bed. Included breakfast buffet in the moring, wine in a drawing room late afternon. Exttremely accomodating staff, great with restaraunt recommendations, reservations,, calling cabs, etc. Free wireless. Free parking in their little lot. (I think it was free) If you like a nice hotel and are willing to be just a little out of the main, don't hestitate about this one.
reviews.title: such an amazing experience

likes.disliked: — I couldn't say, everything was very well taken care of

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Magnifico Hotel...
reviews.title: Great hotel but a bit far from the city

reviews.text: This is a charming and comfortable hotel in Florence, with excellent deals for bookings in advance. The staff was top shelf, and often could not do enough to make me feel welcome, especially in the breakfast room. The location, just a few blocks out from the center of the city, is ideal, and surprisingly quiet, yet everything of interest is easily within walking distance.
reviews.title: Small and very comfortable hotel well positioned in Florence

likes.disliked: — Some rooms (like mine) with showers only

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel one night. The hotel is about a 15-20 minute walk from major Florence attractions and is located in a safe neighborhood. We paid about 70 Euros for our small 2 bed room. The bathroom was gorgeous but the stunning shower fixtures were clogged and corroded with limescale, so the shower was terrible but pretty to look at. Our room had a high glass ceiling with electric black-out blinds to block out the daylight. In-room WiFi is free if you ask the front desk for a temporary password. The staff is helpful and spoke English fairly well.
reviews.title: Solid 4 star hotel about 15-20 minutes walk to major attractions

reviews.text: i stayed 1 night in this charming small hotel and i was pleased with the room and the staff. also i liked that i could walk out of the chaotic touristic area ,find it nice and clean with garage inside the garden! warmly recommend it-hanna schulman, beersheva, israel
reviews.title: a good hotel outside the touristic chaos
Gold Discovered Again
reviews.text: After a bad experience in London with a supposed FOUR STAR experience, we hit pay dirt in Florence. The Lorenzo Il Magnifico is all FOUR STAR at a reasonable price. Rooms excellent, bath is modern, jacuzzi tub and separate shower, mini bar, outdoor patio, private parking, outstanding breakfast and excellent staff. But the most important is their location. Just off the busy feeder streets, the hotel is about a 15 minute walk to the Ponte Vecchio and the river. What a find. Thanks Lorenzo! We'll be back.
On arrival to this Hotel we were welcomed by a clerly inexperienced young female receptionist who just about managed to hand over a key for the room.
reviews.title: Not the best location

description: The villa was built in the end of the eighteenth century and has been recently restored, maintaining the fascinating atmosphere of the ancient college. The coffered ceiling, reconstituted marble flooring, mosaics and frescos constitute our hotels private collection.
